comments:
(This may already be fixed but) With the latest I20030128 build, I cannot 
launch a Runtime-workpsace. I performed the following steps:

1) updated to I20030128 but keep my workspace from I20030122
2) Deleted all my old launch configurations
3) created a new one.
4) got the following exception in the log when I tried to launch from the debug 
menu

!SESSION Jan 29, 2003 09:23:48.718 ---------------------------------------------
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn131-20020403 (JIT enabled: 
jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data D:\dev\workspace -
debug -install file:D:/dev/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 2 1 Jan 29, 2003 09:23:48.718
!MESSAGE Skipping builder org.eclipse.releng.tools.mapFileValidator for project 
org.eclipse.releng. Either the builder is missing from the install, or it 
belongs to a project nature that is missing or disabled.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.core 4 0 Jan 29, 2003 13:09:44.621
!MESSAGE Illegal attempt to change read-only plug-in manifest model
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 120 Jan 29, 2003 13:13:59.58
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug UI: 
!STACK 0
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.valida
tePlugins(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:370)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.create
WorkspaceRunnerConfiguration(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:158)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch
(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$2.run(DebugUITools.java:465)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:95)

Fixed.
launcher code should protect against dangerous workspaces such as this 
particular one :-)

It's great that this is fixed but is there any workaround. I have changes I 
would like to test but I can't launch. If there's no work-around, I'll be 
forced to reconstruct a new workspace with my changes.
*** Bug 30737 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
